body_content.explanation: a name that a transgender person (= a person whose gender does not match the body they were born with) or non-binary person (= a person who has a gender that is not male or female) was called by that they no longer use because it matched the gender they were said to have at birth:
examples: Many transgender people find their deadnames emotionally triggering and painful to hear.
Among trans and queer people, names you no longer use are often called "dead names" or "birth names".
